oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "The Gateway to the South & West -- Memphis, Tenn." Postcard Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Exterior Side One: "The Gateway to the South & West -- Memphis, Tenn. -- 'down in Dixie' -- Lumber -- Cotton -- Industry -- Largest Hardwood Lumber Center and Cotton Warehouses in the World" text; address "Miss Evelyn Gaston -- 1615 24th Ave -- Meridian, Miss."; Includes postmark and 3 cent stamp;

Interior: "Memphis, Down-In-Dixie -- Welcomes You" introductory text; "Greetings from Memphis" image; "Main Street Looking North from Union Avenue" image; "Shelby County Court House" image; "Administration Bldg., Southwestern University" image; "United States Custom House, Court House and Post Office" image; "Sterick Building at Night" image; "Aerial View of Memphis Business District" image; "Memphis Zoo" image; "Rainbow Lake in Overton Park" image; "Aerial View of the New Memphis and Arkansas Bridge, and Memphis and Harahan Bridges Spanning Mississippi River" image; "River Front and Levee to Business District" image; "Confederate Park, Post Office and Mississippi River by Moonlight" image; "Sears, Roebuck and Company" image; "Mississippi River and Riverside Drive by Moonlight" image; "Court Square, showing Sterick Bldg. in Background" image; "Administration Building, Memphis Municipal Airport" image; "Auditorium" image; "This is a bird's eye view of Tenn. -- Love, Billy" handwritten note;
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: buildings; streets; parks; downtown; Mississippi River;
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Gift of Lloyd Nason; Digitized by S. Frierson
